revision.comment: I'm going to write a lot more on the topological sense someday, but for now ....
revision.text:
In classical [[geometry]], a '''point''' is an entity that has no extent. In the modern [[set]] theoretic approach to [[topology]], this is formalised as: a '''point''' in a [[topological space|space]] <var>X</var> is simply an element of the set <var>X</var>.
In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]], and in computer displays usually one [[pixel]].
In [[sport]] and [[game]], a point is a unit of [[scoring]].

In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]], and in computer displays usually one [[pixel]].
In [[sport]] and [[game]], a point is a unit of [[scoring]].

In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often one or four [[pixel]]s.
In [[sport]] and [[game]], a point is a unit of [[scoring]].

revision.comment: Point as in "two points abaft the starboard beam"
revision.text:
[[da:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[pt:Ponto]] In classical [[geometry]], a '''point''' is an entity that has no extent. In the modern [[set]] theoretic approach to [[topology]], this is formalised as: a '''point''' in a [[topological space|space]] <var>X</var> is simply an element of the set <var>X</var>.
See also: ''[[solution point]]'' ---- In [[navigation]], especially at see, a '''point''' is defined as one eighth of a right angle, and therefore equals exactly 11.25 degrees. For example, a bearing of northwest by north differs by one point from a northwest bearing, and by a point from a north-northwest one. ---- In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often one or four [[pixel]]s. ---- In [[sport]]s and [[game]]s, a '''point''' is a unit of [[scoring]]. ---- A '''point''' on a [[railroad]] is also called a [[railroad switch]].

revision.comment: Was that *my* slip of the pen?? [blush]]. Also, refine "pixel" ref.
revision.text:
[[da:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[pt:Ponto]] In classical [[geometry]], a '''point''' is an entity that has no extent. In the modern [[set]] theoretic approach to [[topology]], this is formalised as: a '''point''' in a [[topological space|space]] <var>X</var> is simply an element of the set <var>X</var>.
See also: ''[[solution point]]'' ---- In [[navigation]], especially at sea, a '''point''' is defined as one eighth of a right angle, and therefore equals exactly 11.25 degrees. For example, a bearing of northwest by north differs by one point from a northwest bearing, and by a point from a north-northwest one. ---- In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often the height of one or four [[pixel]]s. ---- In [[sport]]s and [[game]]s, a '''point''' is a unit of [[scoring]]. ---- A '''point''' on a [[railroad]] is also called a [[railroad switch]].

[[de:Punkt]][[da:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[pt:Ponto]] In classical [[geometry]], a '''point''' is an entity that has no extent. In the modern [[set]] theoretic approach to [[topology]], this is formalised as: a '''point''' in a [[topological space|space]] <var>X</var> is simply an element of the set <var>X</var>.
See also: ''[[solution point]]'' ---- In [[navigation]], especially at sea, a '''point''' is defined as one eighth of a right angle, and therefore equals exactly 11.25 degrees. For example, a bearing of northwest by north differs by one point from a northwest bearing, and by a point from a north-northwest one. ---- In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often the height of one or four [[pixel]]s. ---- In [[sport]]s and [[game]]s, a '''point''' is a unit of [[scoring]]. ---- A '''point''' on a [[railroad]] is also called a [[railroad switch]].

[[de:Punkt]][[da:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[pt:Ponto]]
In classical [[geometry]], a '''point''' is an entity that has no extent. In the modern [[set]] theoretic approach to [[topology]], this is formalised as: a '''point''' in a [[topological space|space]] <var>X</var> is simply an element of the set <var>X</var>.
See also: ''[[solution point]]''
----
In [[navigation]], especially at [[sea]], a '''point''' is defined as one eighth of a right angle, and therefore equals exactly 11.25 degrees. For example, a bearing of northwest by north differs by one point from a northwest bearing, and by a point from a north-northwest one.
----
In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often the height of one or four [[pixel]]s.
----
In [[sport]]s and [[game]]s, a '''point''' is a unit of [[scoring]].
----
A '''point''' on a [[railroad]] is also called a [[railroad switch]].
----
{{msg:disambig}}

See also: ''[[solution point]]''
----
In [[navigation]], especially at [[sea]], a '''point''' is defined as one eighth of a right angle, and therefore equals exactly 11.25 degrees. For example, a bearing of northwest by north differs by one point from a northwest bearing, and by a point from a north-northwest one.
----
In [[typography]], a '''point''' is approximately 1/72 [[inch]]; on computer displays it is often the height of one or four [[pixel]]s.

In [[sport]]s and [[game]]s, a '''point''' is a unit of [[scoring]].

A '''point''' on a [[railroad]] is also called a [[railroad switch]].
{{msg:disambig}}

revision.text:
The word '''point''' can refer to: * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * [[point (typography)|point]] is a [[typographic unit]] of measure in [[typography]] equal <math>1/72.27</math> [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as <math>1/72</math> inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * [[scoring]] * [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Geography]] A bluff or natural overlook. * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent) ** an element in a [[set]] ** a related concept in topology: see [[point (topology)]] ** [[solution point]] *[[Points (fur color)|Points]] are a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. {{disambig}}

Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent) ** an element in a [[set]] ** a related concept in topology: see [[point (topology)]] ** [[solution point]] *[[Points (fur color)|Points]] are a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. *"to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and index finger aimed at what is being indicated. {{disambig}}

The word '''point''' can refer to: * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * [[point (typography)|point]] is a [[typographic unit]] of measure in [[typography]] equal <math>1/72.27</math> [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as <math>1/72</math> inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * [[scoring]] * [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Geography]] A bluff or natural overlook. * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]] is a district of the [[Isle of Lewis]] in the [[Outer Hebrides]] of [[Scotland]] * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent) ** an element in a [[set]] ** a related concept in topology: see [[point (topology)]] ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. *[[Points (fur color)|Points]] are a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. *"to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and index finger aimed at what is being indicated. {{disambig}}

The word '''point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * the [[point (typography)|point]] that is a [[typographic unit]] of measure equal <math>1/72.27</math> [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as <math>1/72</math> inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * also in [[typography]], a point may be a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''. * short for [[percentage point]] * [[scoring]] * [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Geography: a bluff or natural overlook. * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]] is a district of the [[Isle of Lewis]] in the [[Outer Hebrides]] of [[Scotland]] * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent) ** an element in a [[set]] *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. *[[Points (coat color)|Points]] are a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. *"to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point_(tennis)|Points]] are units of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. This concept applies to many military scenarios, such as with a road [[convoy]]. * ''point'' is a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in [[cricket]] helloooooooooooooo my name is bob {{disambig}}

revision.text:
The word '''point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * the [[point (typography)|point]] that is a [[typographic unit]] of measure equal <math>1/72.27</math> [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as <math>1/72</math> inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * also in [[typography]], a point may be a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''. * short for [[percentage point]] * [[scoring]] * points; [[railroad switch]] (British English) * points; [[contact breaker]] in an [[ignition system]] * [[Points (coat color)]], a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s * [[Geography]]: a [[bluff]] or natural overlook., e.g. [[Zabriskie Point]] * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]] is a district of the [[Isle of Lewis]] in the [[Outer Hebrides]] of [[Scotland]]. * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include: ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent). ** an element in a [[set]]. *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. * "to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point (tennis)]], unit of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. This concept applies to many military scenarios, such as with a road [[convoy]]. * ''point'' is a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in [[cricket]]
{{disambig}}
[[category:landforms|Point]]

Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include: ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent). ** an element in a [[set]]. *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. * "to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point (tennis)]], unit of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. :''Points redirects here. There is also the US community of [[Points, West Virginia]].'' The word '''point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * the [[point (typography)|point]] that is a [[typographic unit]] of measure equal <math>1/72.27</math> [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as <math>1/72</math> inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * also in [[typography]], a point may be a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''. * short for [[percentage point]] * [[scoring]] * points; [[railroad switch]] (British English) * points; [[contact breaker]] in an [[ignition system]] * [[Points (coat color)]], a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s * [[Geography]]: a [[bluff]] or natural overlook., e.g. [[Zabriskie Point]] * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]] is a district of the [[Isle of Lewis]] in the [[Outer Hebrides]] of [[Scotland]]. * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Mathematical terms include: ** a [[point (geometry)|point]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent). ** an element in a [[set]]. *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. * "to point" means to indicate something with an extended arm and/or index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point (tennis)]], unit of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. This concept applies to many military scenarios, such as with a road [[convoy]]. * ''point'' is a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in [[cricket]]
{{disambig}}
[[category:landforms|Point]]
[[da:Punkt]] [[de:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[fr:Point (mathématiques)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[sl:Točka]] [[uk:Крапка]]

'''Point''', the '''Great Shogun of the Red Empire''', is the most leader of the infamous [http://www.munsterfans.com/forum/default.asp Munsterfans.com]. Joining the site on 02 October 2003 and with 14528 posts to his name, he is a dedicated follower of Munster and Rugby, as well as imbibing of qty’s of alcohol. No stranger to controversy, he is said among some followers to have secret powers, powers that effect the actual running of both Munster rugby and the selection of the team itself.
[[Image:http://www.munsterfans.com/avatars/big/point.gif]]

The word '''point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} * an idealized object, such as [[point charge]] or point mass in [[physics]]. * a [[point in a mortgage]] * a location in physical space * a unit of angular measurement; see [[navigation]] * the [[point (typography)]] that is a [[typographic unit]] of measure equal 1/72.27 [[inch]] or sometimes approximated as 1/72 inch; on computer displays it should be equal to point in typography if the correct display resolution is set, and is often the height of one or two [[pixel]]s if the resolution is set to 72 or 144 [[dpi]] respectively * also in [[typography]], a point may be a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''. * short for [[percentage point]] * A unit indicating a [[player (game)|player]]'s [[score]] in some [[sport]]s and [[computer and video games]] * points; [[railroad switch]] (British English) * points; [[contact breaker]] in an [[ignition system]] * [[Points (coat color)]], a type of fur coloration in [[cat]]s * [[Geography]]: a [[bluff]] or natural overlook., e.g. [[Zabriskie Point]] * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]] is a district of the [[Isle of Lewis]] in the [[Outer Hebrides]] of [[Scotland]]. * the [[meaning]] or [[purpose]] of something, especially statements made during a discussion, argument, or dispute. Also counterpoint. * Points of the [[compass]] refer to the 32 directions represented on a [[Compass rose]] * Mathematical terms include: ** a [[point (geometry)]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent). ** an element in a [[set]]. *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. * "to point" means to indicate the direction or location of something, such as with an extended arm and/or index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point (tennis)]], unit of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. This concept applies to many military scenarios, such as with a road [[convoy]]. * ''point'' is a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in [[cricket]] * '''Point''', the '''Great Shogun of the Red Empire''', is the leader of the infamous [http://www.munsterfans.com/forum/default.asp Munsterfans.com]. Joining the site on 02 October 2003 and with 14528 posts to his name, he is a dedicated follower of Munster and Rugby, as well as imbibing of qty’s of alcohol. No stranger to controversy, he is said among some followers to have secret powers, powers that effect the actual running of both Munster rugby and the selection of the team itself.
[[Image:http://www.munsterfans.com/avatars/big/point.gif]] {{disambig}} [[category:landforms|Point]] [[da:Punkt]] [[de:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[fr:Point (mathématiques)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[sl:Točka]] [[uk:Крапка]]

Also counterpoint. * Points of the [[compass]] refer to the 32 directions represented on a [[Compass rose]] * Mathematical terms include: ** a [[point (geometry)]] in [[geometry]] (an entity that has a location in space but no extent). ** an element in a [[set]]. *** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in [[topology]], or the study of [[vector space]]s or abstract [[geometry]]. ** [[solution point]] * [[Point count]] is a fundamental method of hand evaluation in the [[card game]] of [[contract bridge|bridge]]. * point, or [[en pointe]], is a [[ballet]] maneuver. * "to point" means to indicate the direction or location of something, such as with an extended arm and/or index finger aimed at what is being indicated. * [[Point (tennis)]], unit of scoring in [[tennis]]. * if a person is "point" during a [[military]] [[patrol]], such as a [[reconnaissance]] patrol, then that means that the person is at the front of the patrol. '''Point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} {{TOCright}} ==Mathematics== In '''mathematics''': * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent ** [[Fixed point (mathematics)]], a point that is mapped to itself by a mathematical function ** [[Point at infinity]] ** [[Point group]] ** [[Point charge]], an idealized model of a particle which has an electric charge * [[Solution point]] * [[Percentage point]], one hundredth ** [[Point in a mortgage]], one percent of the loan amount ** [[Point and figure chart]], used for technical analysis of percentages in securities * [[Floating point]] and [[fixed-point arithmetic]] * an element in a [[set]] ** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in topology and other fields
==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In [[navigation]]: ** ''Point'', one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]] ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a [[carat]] * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material
==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook
==Technology== * ''Points'', a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * ''Points''; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of view]], the perspective from an individual's standpoint * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** [[Point (military)]], the person at the front of a reconnaissance patrol, column or convoy ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]]
==Other== * [[Meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute. See also [[counterpoint]]. * ''Point'', in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''
==See also== * [[Pointer (disambiguation)]] * [[Tipping point]] * [[Turning point]] * [[Vanishing point]]
{{disambig-cleanup}}
[[Category:Landforms|Point]]

revision.text:
'''Point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} {{TOCright}} ==Mathematics== In '''mathematics''': * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent ** [[Fixed point (mathematics)]], a point that is mapped to itself by a mathematical function ** [[Point at infinity]] ** [[Point group]] ** [[Point charge]], an idealized model of a particle which has an electric charge * [[Solution point]] * [[Percentage point]], one hundredth ** [[Point in a mortgage]], one percent of the loan amount ** [[Point and figure chart]], used for technical analysis of percentages in securities * [[Floating point]] and [[fixed-point arithmetic]] * an element in a [[set]] ** an element of the base [[set]] of a structure, in topology and other fields
==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In [[navigation]]: ** ''Point'', one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]] ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a [[carat]] * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material
==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook
==Technology== * ''Points'', a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * ''Points''; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of view]], the perspective from an individual's standpoint * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]]
==Other== * [[Meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute. See also [[counterpoint]]. * ''Point'', in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''
==See also== * [[Pointer (disambiguation)]] * [[Tipping point]] * [[Turning point]] * [[Vanishing point]]
{{disambig-cleanup}}
[[Category:Landforms|Point]]
[[bg:Точка]] [[da:Punkt]] [[de:Punkt]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[ja:ポイント (曖昧さ回避)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[sl:Točka]] [[uk:Крапка]]

==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In [[navigation]]: ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of scoring in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]] ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material

==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats

revision.comment: + Geog: points on rivers; + Place name: Point PA
revision.text:
'''Point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} {{TOCright}} ==Mathematics== In '''mathematics''': * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent ** [[Fixed point (mathematics)]], a point that is mapped to itself by a mathematical function ** [[Point at infinity]] ** [[Point group]] ** [[Point charge]], an idealized model of a particle which has an electric charge * [[Solution point]] * [[Percentage point]], one hundredth ** [[Point in a mortgage]], one percent of the loan amount ** [[Point and figure chart]], used for technical analysis of percentages in securities * [[Floating point]] and [[fixed-point arithmetic]] * an element in the base [[set]] of a structure, in topology and other fields
==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In navigation: ** [[Navigation#"Point" measure of direction|Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of scoring in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]] ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material
==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook * On a river, the land around which the river flows at a bend, for instance [[Algiers Point]] on the [[Mississippi River]] (similar to a promontory)
==Technology== * ''Points'', a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * ''Points''; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of view]], the perspective from an individual's standpoint * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]] * In [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]], the '''Point''' refers to the location of confluence of the [[Allegheny River|Allegheny]] and [[Monongahela River|Monongahela]] Rivers
==Other== * [[Meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute. See also [[counterpoint]]. * ''Point'', in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, ''[[decimal point]]''
==See also== * [[Pointer (disambiguation)]] * [[Tipping point]] * [[Turning point]] * [[Vanishing point]]
{{disambig-cleanup}}

* [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent ** [[Fixed point (mathematics)]], a point that is mapped to itself by a mathematical function ** [[Point at infinity]], also ideal point, a point which when added to the real number line yields the real projective line ** [[Point group]], a group of geometric symmetries (isometries) leaving a point fixed ** [[Point charge]], an idealized model of a particle which has an electric charge * [[Equation|Solution point]] * [[Percentage point]], proper unit for the arithmetic difference of two percentages ** [[Point in a mortgage]], one percent of the loan amount ** [[Point and figure chart]], used for technical analysis of percentages in securities * [[Floating point]] and [[fixed-point arithmetic]], a digital representation for a number in a certain subset of the rational numbers; often used in computers * an element in the base [[set]] of a structure, in topology and other fields
==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In navigation: ** [[Navigation#"Point" measure of direction|Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of scoring in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing ** In Australian Football, a "point" often refers to a [[behind]] * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material
==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook
==Technology== * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of view]], the perspective from an individual's standpoint * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In [[reconnaissance]], the soldier or team at the head of a patrol, column, or convoy ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Extreme points of the world]], the highest, most inaccessible, farthest north, south, etc.
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]]
==Other== * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * Point, in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[middle dot]]) as in the expression, [[decimal point]]
==See also== * [[Pointer (disambiguation)]] * [[Point of no return (disambiguation)]] * [[Tipping point]] * [[Turning point]] * [[Vanishing point]]
{{disambig}}

'''Point''' can refer to: {{wiktionary}} {{TOCright}} ==Mathematics==
* [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent ** [[Fixed point (mathematics)]], a point that is mapped to itself by a mathematical function ** [[Point at infinity]], also ideal point, a point which when added to the real number line yields the real projective line ** [[Point group]], a group of geometric symmetries (isometries) leaving a point fixed ** [[Point charge]], an idealized model of a particle which has an electric charge * [[Equation|Solution point]] * [[Percentage point]], proper unit for the arithmetic difference of two percentages ** [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount ** [[Point and figure chart]], used for technical analysis of percentages in securities * [[Floating point]] and [[fixed-point arithmetic]], a digital representation for a number in a certain subset of the rational numbers; often used in computers * an element in the base [[set]] of a structure, in topology and other fields
==Measurement== * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * In navigation: ** [[Navigation#"Point" measure of direction|Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) ** [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass ** [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * A unit of scoring in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game ** [[Extra point]], in American and Canadian football ** [[Point count]], a method of hand evaluation in the card game of bridge ** [[Point shaving]], an illegal form of match fixing ** In Australian Football, a "point" often refers to a [[behind]] ** "Point" is a unit used in measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)|game]][http://www.boone-crockett.org/bgRecords/records_overview.asp] * [[Point (gemstone)]], equivalent to one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point blanket]], a trading item measured by the number of stripes ("points") woven into the material
==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook
==Technology== * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In [[reconnaissance]], the soldier or team at the head of a patrol, column, or convoy ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Extreme points of the world]], the highest, most inaccessible, farthest north, south, etc.
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]]

==Geography== * A [[promontory]] extended into a body of water ** [[Point break]], the way ocean waves break around a point * A [[bluff]] or natural overlook
==Technology== * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Location== * [[Point mutation]], a mutation at a specific position on a gene * [[Point of sale]], in merchandising, the location where a transaction occurs * [[Point of presence]], an interface point between communications entities * [[Point-to-point]] and [[point-to-multipoint]], types of wireless data communications * [[Point-to-point construction]], a method of soldering electronic components * [[Point source]], a source of light, fluid flow, or pollution
==Aim== * [[Point-and-click]], computer mouse terminology * [[Point and shoot camera]] * [[Point-blank range]], in ballistics, the range where pointing is sufficient, and gravity and wind can be ignored * [[Point shooting]], a method of aiming firearms
==Extremity== * An individual at the furthest forward position in a group: ** In [[reconnaissance]], the soldier or team at the head of a patrol, column, or convoy ** In sports, the team member who plays furthest forward: *** [[Point guard]], in basketball *** [[fielding (cricket)|Point]], in cricket *** [[The point (ice hockey)]] * [[En pointe]], dancing on the toes, in ballet * [[Points (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Extreme points of the world]], the highest, most inaccessible, farthest north, south, etc.
==Place name== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland *[[Points, West Virginia]]
==Other== * points used to keep [[score]] in a game * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * Point, in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[Interpunct|middle dot]]) as in the expression, [[decimal point]] * To ''point'' is to indicate an object or direction by extending the index finger (and possibly the arm) in the direction required. * [[Point targets]]
==See also== * [[Pointer (disambiguation)]] * [[Point of no return (disambiguation)]] * [[Tipping point]] * [[Turning point]] * [[Vanishing point]]
{{disambig}}

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * Point, one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). See [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction]] * "Point" is a unit used in measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)|game]] * Among narcotics users, a "point" is a decigram, or 0.1 of a [[gram]] * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
* Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * Point, in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[Interpunct|middle dot]]) as in the expression, [[decimal point]]
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]]
==Sports== * Point, a unit of [[score|scoring]] in some sports and games * [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis * [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time ** Point, in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[Interpunct|middle dot]]) as in the expression, [[decimal point]] * "Point" is a unit used in measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)|game]] * Among narcotics users, a "point" is a decigram, or 0.1 of a [[gram]] * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system]], a system whereby the driver's licensing authorities issue demerits, or points to drivers upon the conviction of a traffic infractions

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (hunting)]], an individual branch on an [[antler]] ** Point, in typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]]; [[Interpunct|middle dot]]) as in the expression, [[decimal point]] * "Point" is a unit used in measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)|game]] * Among narcotics users, a "point" is a decigram, or 0.1 of a [[gram]] * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points; [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system]], a system whereby the driver's licensing authorities issue demerits, or points to drivers upon the conviction of a traffic infractions * [[take point|Taking point]], being the lead element in a military formation * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]]; [[harakat]] for [[Arabic language|Arabic]]
In '''navigation''': * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * Point, one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). See [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction]] * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction
'''places''': * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Palmer Trinity School]], a [[highschool]] in [[Palmetto Bay]], [[Florida]].
In '''sports''': * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games * [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis * [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * Shortened form for the position of [[point guard]] in basketball
{{disambig}}

revision.comment: * [[Point (military)]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a [[patrol]] needs an article
revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space but no extent * [[Point (military)]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a [[patrol]] * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, whose meaning has changed over time * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]]), [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * A branch on an [[antler]] * A unit for measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)]] * Among narcotics users, a "point" is a decigram, or 0.1 of a [[gram]] * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[take point|Taking point]], being the lead element in a military formation * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for [[Hebrew language]]; [[harakat]] for [[Arabic language|Arabic]] * In the [[Bob Seger]] song "[[Night Moves]]", "points" is used as a euphemism for breasts * Also see [[The Point]]
In '''navigation''': * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction |Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction
'''places''': * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Palmer Trinity School]], a [[highschool]] in [[Palmetto Bay]], [[Florida]].
In '''sports''' and '''games''': * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * Shortened form for the position of [[point guard]] in basketball
{{disambig}}

revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute ** [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or a plane but no extent * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a [[patrol]] * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, whose meaning has changed over time * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]]), [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * A branch on an [[antler]] * A unit for measuring and evaluating [[Game (food)]] * Among narcotics users, a "point" is a decigram, or 0.1 of a [[gram]] * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[take point|Taking point]], being the lead element in a military formation * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for [[Hebrew language]]; [[harakat]] for [[Arabic language|Arabic]] * In the [[Bob Seger]] song "[[Night Moves]]", "points" is used as a euphemism for breasts * [[Point Music]], a record label * Also see [[The Point]]
In '''navigation''': * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction |Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction
'''places''': * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Palmer Trinity School]], a [[high school]] in [[Palmetto Bay]], [[Florida]].
In '''sports''' and '''games''': * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * Shortened form for the position of [[point guard]] in basketball
{{disambig}}
;See also *[[Punt]] *[[Punkt]]
[[bs:Tačka (čvor)]] [[bg:Точка]] [[ca:Punt]] [[da:Punkt (flertydig)]] [[de:Punkt]] [[es:Punto]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[fr:Point]] [[hr:Točka]] [[hu:Pont]] [[nl:Punt]] [[ja:ポイント (曖昧さ回避)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[ru:Точка (значения)]] [[sk:Bod]] [[sl:Točka]] [[sr:Тачка]] [[uk:Крапка]] [[zh-yue:點]]

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * Point and counterpoint, [[meaning]] or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or a plane but no extent * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a [[patrol]] * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, whose meaning has changed over time * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]]), [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[take point|Taking point]], being the lead element in a military formation * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for [[Hebrew language]]; [[harakat]] for [[Arabic language|Arabic]] * [[Point Music]], a record label * [[Point (landform)]] * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Conversion_of_units#Length|Unit of length]] * Also see [[The Point]]
In '''navigation''': * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction |Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction
'''places''': * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Palmer Trinity School]], a [[high school]] in [[Palmetto Bay]], [[Florida]].
In '''sports''' and '''games''': * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * Shortened form for the position of [[point guard]] in basketball
{{disambig}}
;See also *[[Punt]] *[[Punkt]]

revision.comment: Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/71.243.44.89]] to version by LonesomeMoon. If this is a mistake, [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. (83629) (Bot)
revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or a plane but no extent * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a [[patrol]] * [[Point (typography)]], a printing measurement, whose meaning has changed over time * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]]), [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in cats * [[Point (gemstone)]] (2 mg) or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of the loan amount * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[take point|Taking point]], being the lead element in a military formation * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for [[Hebrew language]]; [[harakat]] for [[Arabic language|Arabic]] * [[Point Music]], a record label * [[Point (landform)]] * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Conversion_of_units#Length|Unit of length]] * [[Le Point]], a french weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)]], a 2001 album by [[Cornelius (musician)|Cornelius]]
* Also see [[The Point]]
In '''navigation''': * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass * [[Navigation#"Point system" measure of direction |Point]], one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees). * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction
'''places''': * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Palmer Trinity School]], a [[high school]] in [[Palmetto Bay]], [[Florida]].
In '''sports''' and '''games''': * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * Shortened form for the position of [[point guard]] in basketball
{{disambig}}
;See also *[[Punt]] *[[Punkt]]
[[bs:Tačka (čvor)]] [[bg:Точка]] [[ca:Punt]] [[da:Punkt (flertydig)]] [[de:Punkt]] [[el:Σημείο (αποσαφήνιση)]] [[es:Punto]] [[eo:Punkto]] [[fr:Point]] [[hr:Točka]] [[hu:Pont]] [[nl:Punt]] [[ja:ポイント (曖昧さ回避)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[ru:Точка (значения)]] [[sk:Bod]] [[sl:Točka]] [[sr:Тачка]] [[uk:Крапка]] [[vi:Điểm]] [[zh-yue:點]]

==In mathematics, science and technology== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
===In technology=== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of a loan amount * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)

==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Le Point]], a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)

revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==In mathematics, science and technology== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
===In technology=== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of a loan amount * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Le Point]], a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

===In technology=== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of a loan amount * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Le Point]], a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Le Point]], a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of antler tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck)
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

==In mathematics, science and technology== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula

===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * Point, for describing paper stock thickness, a synonym of "mil" or "[[thou (length)|thou]]" (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of a loan amount * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees)

==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck)
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Point (mortgage)]], one percent of a loan amount * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper stock thickness, a synonym of "mil" or "[[thou (length)|thou]]" (one thousandth of an inch)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck)
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Point No. 1|Point #1]], a 1999 album by [[Chevelle]] * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a [[mortgage loan]].
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==In mathematics, science and technology== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
===In technology=== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output.
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one-hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100<sup>th</sup> of one percent, denoted bp, bps, or ‱ * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper stock thickness, a synonym of "mil" or "[[thou (length)|thou]]" (one thousandth of an inch)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]]) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a [[mortgage loan]].
==See also== *[[The Point]] (disambiguation)
{{disambig}}

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==In mathematics, science and technology== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Point (coat color)]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
===In technology=== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output.
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in cricket * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * Point and counterpoint, meaning or [[purpose]], especially in a discussion or dispute * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]] ) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a [[mortgage loan]].
