{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' can refer to: {{TOC_right}}
== In mathematics == * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change. * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output. * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a [[financial market]] that is used as a [[predictive indicator]] of [[market movement]].
== in science == * [[Point (coat color) |point color]], fur coloration of the extremities, in animals * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
=== In technology and engineering === * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
===Units of measurement=== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 mm, used for shoe sizes. * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage. It is sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]].
== Notable places == * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==In sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding]] position in [[cricket]] * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other uses== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]] ) * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Point Music]], a record label
==See also== * [[The Point]] (disambiguation) * [[Endpoint]] (disambiguation) * [[Point No. 1|Point #1]], a 1999 album of Chevelle {{disambig}}

==Measurement units== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 mm, used for shoe sizes * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]]
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball
==Other== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]]) * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic
==Boets== '''* Joris broekloos''' * [[Endpoint]] (disambiguation) * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' may refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==Engineering and technology== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Entertainment== * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point Music]], a record label * [[Point No. 1|Point #1]], a 1999 album of Chevelle
==Geography== * [[Point (geography)]]
==Mathematics and science== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement
===Science=== * [[Point (coat color) |Point color]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * [[Point (landform)]], a peninsula
==Measurement units== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 mm, used for shoe sizes * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]]
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island]] (disambiguation)

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' may refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==Engineering== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Entertainment== * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point Music]], a record label * [[Point No. 1|Point #1]], a 1999 album of Chevelle
==Geography== * [[Point (geography)]], a peninsula
==Mathematics, finance, and science== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Mortgage_points]], a form of prepaid interest on a loan * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point (coat color) |Point color]], animal fur coloration of the extremities
==Measurement units== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey, lacrosse)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]]

==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]]) * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard
==See also== * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' may refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==Engineering== * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system
==Entertainment== * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point Music]], a record label * [[Point No. 1|Point #1]], a 1999 album of Chevelle
==Geography== * [[Point (geography)]], a peninsula
==Mathematics, finance, and science== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point (coat color) |Point color]], animal fur coloration of the extremities
==Measurement units== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes * A measurement used in [[hunting]], referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck)
==Places== * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]], a district of the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland * [[Point Judith, Rhode Island]] * [[Point Monroe, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Point White, Bainbridge Island, Washington]] * [[Points, West Virginia]] * [[Point Island (disambiguation)]] asa naman
==Sports== * Point, a unit of [[Score (gaming)|scoring]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] / [[Point (lacrosse)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]]) * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard
==See also== * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}
[[ar:نقطة]] [[bs:Tačka (čvor)]] [[ca:Punt]] [[da:Punkt (flertydig)]] [[de:Point]] [[el:Σημείο (αποσαφήνιση)]] [[es:Punto]] [[eo:Punkto (apartigilo)]] [[fr:Point]] [[hr:Točka]] [[hu:Pont]] [[it:Punto]] [[nl:Punt]] [[ja:ポイント (曖昧さ回避)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[ro:Point]] [[ru:Точка (значения)]] [[sk:Bod]] [[sl:Točka]] [[sr:Тачка]] [[uk:Крапка]] [[vi:Điểm]] [[zh:點]] [[zh-yue:點]]

==Mathematics, finance, and science== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single nucleotide and therefore in a specific codon * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy
==Measurement units== * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes * A measurement used in hunting, referring to the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck)
==Sports== * Point, a unit of the [[score (game)]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (ice hockey)]] / [[Point (lacrosse)]], a goal or assist a player earns during a game * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * In typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * In specialized character set (e.g.: dot and dash in [[morse code]], dots in [[braille]]) * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard
==See also== * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' may refer to: {{TOC_right}}
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[POINT Music]], a record label * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle
==Geography== * Point, a [[peninsula]] (see [[List of peninsulas]])
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet[http://www.professionalgambler.com/vigorish.html] or [[loanshark]]'s loan
==Mathematics, finance, and science== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Stationary point]] or [[turning point]], a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific [[codon]]
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (game)]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets (e.g.: dot in [[Morse code]], dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}
[[ar:نقطة]] [[bs:Tačka (čvor)]] [[ca:Punt]] [[da:Punkt (flertydig)]] [[de:Point]] [[el:Σημείο (αποσαφήνιση)]] [[es:Punto]] [[eo:Punkto (apartigilo)]] [[fr:Point]] [[hr:Točka]] [[hu:Pont]] [[it:Punto]] [[nl:Punt]] [[ja:ポイント (曖昧さ回避)]] [[no:Punkt]] [[pl:Punkt]] [[pt:Ponto]] [[ro:Point]] [[ru:Точка (значения)]] [[sk:Bod]] [[sl:Točka]] [[sr:Тачка]] [[uk:Крапка]] [[vi:Điểm]] [[zh:點]] [[zh-yue:點]]

==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet[http://www.professionalgambler.com/vigorish.html] or [[loanshark]]'s loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label
==Geography== * Point, a [[peninsula]] (see [[List of peninsulas]]) * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific [[codon]]
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (game)]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets (e.g.: dot in [[Morse code]], dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[En pointe]], a technique in [[ballet]]
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[prizes]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes 3 cm
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific [[codon]]
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (game)]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets (e.g.: dot in [[Morse code]], dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[En pointe]], a technique in [[ballet]]
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}}
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or [[loanshark]]'s loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label *[[Royalty Points]] a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders.
==Geography== * Point, a [[peninsula]] (see [[List of peninsulas]]) * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes 3 cm
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific [[codon]]
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (game)]] in some sports and games: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets (e.g.: dot in [[Morse code]], dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[En pointe]], a technique in [[ballet]]
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

revision.text:
{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}}
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or [[loanshark]]'s loan

==Mathematics== {{See also|List of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible *[[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes 3 cm

{{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}}
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce [[interest rate]]s in a [[mortgage loan]] * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or [[loanshark]]'s loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label *[[Royalty points]] a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders.
==Geography== * Point, a [[peninsula]] (see [[List of peninsulas]]) * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible *[[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes 3 cm
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point Mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific [[codon]] * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram.
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets (e.g.: dot in [[Morse code]], dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character (e.g.: [[full stop]], [[interpunct]], [[decimal point]], [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language and [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[En pointe]], a technique in [[ballet]]
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a [[right angle]] (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a [[Carat (mass)|carat]] * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g.: 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes 3 cm

==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[full stop]] ** [[interpunct]] ** [[decimal point]] ** [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], used in ballet when dancing on the tips of the toes
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[full stop]] ** [[interpunct]] ** [[decimal point]] ** [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], used in ballet when dancing on the tips of the toes
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

revision.text:
{{Technical reasons|Point #1|the Chevelle album|Point No. 1}} {{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}}
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a mortgage loan * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or loanshark's loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label *[[Royalty points]], a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** a shape that is indivisible *[[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * [[Element (category theory)|Element]] (or a point), generalizes the set theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes

==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[full stop]] ** [[interpunct]] ** [[decimal point]] ** [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], used in ballet when dancing on the tips of the toes

==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** More generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * [[Element (category theory)|Element]] (or a point), generalizes the set theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific codon * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[full stop]] ** [[interpunct]] ** [[decimal point]] ** [[radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], used in ballet when dancing on the tips of the toes
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe]]/Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point (disambiguation) * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

{{Technical reasons|Point #1|the Chevelle album|Point No. 1}} {{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}} ==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Percentage point]]s, used to measure a change in percentage absolutely * [[Pivot point]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a mortgage loan * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or loanshark's loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Points (Matthew Shipp album)|''Points'' (Matthew Shipp album)]], an album by jazz pianist [[Matthew Shipp]] * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label *[[Royalty points]], a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** More generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]] (or turning point), a point in a set of inputs to a function where the output ceases to change * [[Element (category theory)|Element]] (or a point), generalizes the set theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific codon * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram

==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]] ** [[Interpunct]] ** [[Decimal point]] ** [[Radix point]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[Niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[Harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA

revision.text:
{{Technical reasons|Point #1|the Chevelle album|Point No. 1}} {{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}} ==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Percentage point]]s, used to measure a change in percentage absolutely * [[Pivot point (stock market)]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a mortgage loan * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or loanshark's loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly news magazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Points (Matthew Shipp album)|''Points'' (Matthew Shipp album)]], an album by jazz pianist [[Matthew Shipp]] * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label *[[Royalty points]], a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent ** More generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]], a point in the domain of a single-valued function where the value of the function ceases to change * [[Critical point (mathematics)]], a stationary point of a function of an arbitrary number of variables * [[Element (category theory)|Element]] (or a point), generalizes the set theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific codon * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram
==Sports== * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (American football)]] ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Other== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)]] * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]] ** [[Interpunct]] ** [[Decimal point]] ** [[Radix point]] * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * Vowel points: ** [[Niqqud]] for the Hebrew language ** [[Harakat]] for Arabic * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe (disambiguation)|Lapointe]]/Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point (disambiguation) * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

==Games and sports== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)]] * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (American football)]] ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent; more generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]], a point in the domain of a single-valued function where the value of the function ceases to change * [[Critical point (mathematics)|Critical point]], a stationary point of a function of an arbitrary number of variables * [[Element (category theory)|Element]] (or a point), generalizes the set-theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Parliamentary procedure== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Raise a question of privilege|Point of privilege]], a matter related to the rights and privileges of a parliamentary body or of one or more of its members
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific codon * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram
==Typography== * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]], [[Interpunct]], [[Decimal point]] or [[Radix point]] * Vowel points, used to disambiguated a consonantal writing system: ** [[Arabic diacritics|Tashkīl]] and [[ḥarakāt]] for Arabic, Persian, Urdu, etc., or [[Niqqud]] for Hebrew
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * [[USCG Point class cutter|Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA

==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly newsmagazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Points (Matthew Shipp album)|''Points'' (Matthew Shipp album)]], an album by jazz pianist [[Matthew Shipp]] * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label
==Games and sports== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)]] * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (American football)]] ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent; more generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]], a point in the domain of a single-valued function where the value of the function ceases to change * [[Critical point (mathematics)]], a stationary point of a function of an arbitrary number of variables * Point, or [[Element (category theory)|Element]], generalizes the set-theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Parliamentary procedure== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point of privilege]], a matter related to the rights and privileges of a parliamentary body or of one or more of its members
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single [[nucleotide]] and therefore in a specific codon * Point (amphetamines), one tenth of a gram
==Typography== * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]], [[Interpunct]], [[Decimal point]] or [[Radix point]] * Vowel points, used to disambiguated a consonantal writing system: ** [[Arabic diacritics|Tashkīl]] and [[Arabic diacritics|ḥarakāt]] for Arabic, Persian, Urdu, etc., or [[Niqqud]] for Hebrew
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]]) * [[Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe (disambiguation)]], also Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}

{{Technical reasons|Point #1|the Chevelle album|Point No. 1}} {{wiktionarypar|point}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to the following: {{TOC_right}}
==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Percentage point]]s, used to measure a change in percentage absolutely * [[Pivot point (stock market)]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a mortgage loan * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Royalty points]], a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or loanshark's loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly newsmagazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Points (Matthew Shipp album)|''Points'' (Matthew Shipp album)]], by jazz pianist Matthew Shipp * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label
==Games and sports== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)]] * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (American football)]], a unit of scoring earned through a field goal or touchdown ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]] in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Geography== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent; more generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]], a point in the domain of a single-valued function where the value of the function ceases to change * [[Critical point (mathematics)]], a stationary point of a function of an arbitrary number of variables * Point, or [[Element (category theory)|Element]], generalizes the set-theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Parliamentary procedure== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point of privilege]], a matter related to the rights and privileges of a parliamentary body or of one or more of its members
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single nucleotide and therefore in a specific codon
==Typography== * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]], [[Interpunct]], [[Decimal point]] or [[Radix point]] * Vowel points, used to disambiguated a consonantal writing system: ** [[Arabic diacritics|Tashkīl]] and [[Arabic diacritics|ḥarakāt]] for Arabic, Persian, Urdu, etc., or [[Niqqud]] for Hebrew
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]] * [[Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA * [[Public Oregon Intercity Transit]], styled as POINT, a public transit system
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe (disambiguation)]], also Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}}
{{disambig}}

revision.text:
{{Technical reasons|Point #1|the Chevelle album|Point No. 1}} {{wiktionary|point|points}} '''Point''' or '''points''' may refer to:
{{tocright}} ==Business and finance== * [[Basis point]], 1/100 of one percent, denoted ''bp'', ''bps'', and ''‱'' * [[Percentage point]]s, used to measure a change in percentage absolutely * [[Pivot point (technical analysis)]], a price level of significance in analysis of a financial market that is used as a predictive indicator of market movement * [[Point (mortgage)]], a percentage sometimes referred to as a form of pre-paid interest used to reduce interest rates in a mortgage loan * Reward points (see [[loyalty program]]), marketing strategy * [[Royalty points]], a way of sharing profit between companies and unit holders * [[Vigorish]] point, the commission charged on a gambling bet or loanshark's loan
==Engineering== * Points, a [[contact breaker]] in an ignition system * Points, a [[railroad switch]] (British English) * [[Points of sail]], a sailing boat's course in relation to wind direction * [[Projectile point]], a hafted archaeological artifact used as a knife or projectile tip
==Entertainment== * ''[[Le Point]]'', a French weekly newsmagazine * [[Point (album)|''Point'' (album)]], a 2001 album by Cornelius * [[Points (Matthew Shipp album)|''Points'' (Matthew Shipp album)]], by jazz pianist Matthew Shipp * [[Point No. 1|''Point #1'']], a 1999 album of Chevelle * [[POINT Music]], a record label
==Games and sports== * Point, any of various abstract quantities used in games to determine a score; see [[Score (game)|Score]] * Point, a [[fielding (cricket)|fielding position in cricket]] * Point, a unit of the [[score (sport)|score]] in some sports: ** [[Point (basketball)]], units obtained by scoring baskets during a game ** [[Point (tennis)]], the smallest unit of scoring in tennis ** [[Point (American football)]], a unit of scoring earned through a field goal or touchdown ** Point, in [[Point (ice hockey)|ice hockey]] or lacrosse, a goal or assist a player earns during a game * [[Points decision]], in boxing and some other fighting sports * [[The point (ice hockey)]], the location of an ice hockey player * [[Point guard]], in basketball * [[Points (association football)]]
==Places== * Point, a [[promontory]] usually shorter than a cape * [[Point, Outer Hebrides]]
==Mathematics== {{See also|List of mathematical properties of points}} * [[Point (geometry)]], an entity that has a location in space or on a plane, but has no extent; more generally, an element of some abstract [[topological space]] * [[Point-free geometry]] * [[Stationary point]], a point in the domain of a single-valued function where the value of the function ceases to change * [[Critical point (mathematics)]], a stationary point of a function of an arbitrary number of variables * Point, or [[Element (category theory)]], generalizes the set-theoretic concept of an element of a set to an object of any category
==Measurement units== * [[Compass point]], one of the 32 directions on a traditional compass, equal to one eighth of a right angle (11.25 degrees) * [[Point (gemstone)]], 2 milligrams, or one hundredth of a carat * Point, in hunting, the number of [[antler]] tips on the hunted animal (e.g. 9 point buck) * Point, for describing paper-stock thickness, a synonym of ''mil'' and ''[[Thou (length)|thou]]'' (one thousandth of an inch) * Point, a hundredth of an [[inch]] or 0.254 mm, a unit of measurement formerly used for rainfall in Australia * [[Point (typography)]], a measurement used in printing, the meaning of which has changed over time * [[Paris point]], 2/3 cm, used for shoe sizes
==Parliamentary procedure== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point of privilege]], a matter related to the rights and privileges of a parliamentary body or of one or more of its members
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single nucleotide and therefore in a specific codon
==Typography== * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]], [[Interpunct]], [[Decimal point]] or [[Radix point]] * Vowel points, used to disambiguated a consonantal writing system: ** Tashkīl and ḥarakāt for Arabic, Persian, Urdu, etc., or [[Niqqud]] for Hebrew
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]] * [[Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA * [[Public Oregon Intercity Transit]], styled as POINT, a public transit system
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe (disambiguation)]], also Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * {{look from}} * {{in title}}

==Parliamentary procedure== * [[Point of order]], a matter raised during a debate concerning the rules of debating themselves * [[Point of privilege]], a matter related to the rights and privileges of a parliamentary body or of one or more of its members
==Science== * [[Point (coat color)]], animal fur coloration of the extremities * Point, a data element in a [[SCADA]] system representing a single input or output * [[Point mutation]], a change in a single nucleotide and therefore in a specific codon
==Typography== * Point, in typography, a [[Dot (disambiguation)#Typography|dot]] character: ** [[Full stop]], [[Interpunct]], [[Decimal point]] or [[Radix point]] * Vowel points, used to disambiguated a consonantal writing system: ** Tashkīl and ḥarakāt for Arabic, Persian, Urdu, etc., or [[Niqqud]] for Hebrew
==Other== * Point, in specialized character sets: ** dot in [[Morse code]] ** dots in [[Braille]] * [[Point Class Cutter]], a small vessel formerly used as a patrol craft by the United States Coast Guard * [[Point man]], the lead soldier or vehicle in a patrol * [[Point system (driving)]], a system of demerits for driving offenses * [[Pointe technique]], ballet technique for dancing on the tips of toes * [[Points, West Virginia]], USA * [[Public Oregon Intercity Transit]], styled as POINT, a public transit system
==See also== * [[Endpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Lapointe (disambiguation)]], also Lepoint/La Pointe/Le Point * [[Midpoint (disambiguation)]] * [[Pointing (disambiguation)]] * [[Prize]] * [[Start Point (disambiguation)]] * [[The Point (disambiguation)]] * {{look from}} * {{in title}}
{{disambiguation}}
